info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 7:55AM EDT until July 16 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen have already fallen over this area from the training thunderstorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with the training thunderstorms during the next couple of hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Doral, Hialeah Gardens, Pinecrest, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, West Miami, Medley, Coral Terrace, Miami International Airport, Westchester, Fountainbleau, University Of Miami, Glenvar Heights, Olympia Heights and Coconut Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING
